RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Possui graduo em letras clssicas e ps-graduao em Arqueologia clssica pela "Universit degli Studi di Catania" (Itlia). Tem experincia de ensino em Lngua e Literatura grega e latina, em Histria antiga e em numismtica antiga. Completou o doutorado em Arqueologia como bolsista da CAPES e da FAPESP no Museu de Arqueologia e Etnologia da Universidade de So Paulo (MAE/USP). Atualmente ps-doutoranda em Histria na UNESP/Franca. membro do Laboratrio de Estudos sobre a Cidade Antiga (LABECA -MAE/USP) e do G.LEIR Franca. especialista na arqueologia da Siclia e em numismtica antiga. Atua nos seguintes temas: Numismtica grega e romana (iconografia e economia), relao entre gregos e no gregos em poca arcica e clssica, Arqueologia da Paisagem.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: Degree in Classical Literature and Master at School of Archaeology in the University of Catania (Italy). Teached as professor of Greek and Latin literature, Ancient History and Greek Numismatic. PhD's grant winner of CAPES e member of LABECA (Laboratrio de Estudos sobre a Cidade Antiga. MAE-USP). In the Sicily's archaeology area, she works with ancient numismatic, networks and archaeological landscape.

OUTRAS-INFORMACOES-RELEVANTES.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES-RELEVANTES: Em 2006 e 2007 foi contemplada com duas bolsas de estudos na Itlia por mrito. No Brasil a sua pesquisa foi fomentada pela CAPES e pela FAPESP (PROC. N. 2015/03580-3).

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Redes de interao entre gregos e no gregos: os frria de fronteira na hinterlndia da Siclia Grega
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: A antiga literatura grega nos transmitiu um rico vocabulrio para descrever a maneira de viver dos povos helnicos espalhados pelo Mediterrneo. Essas mesmas palavras foram usadas para definir formas de organizao social e urbana dos povos no gregos, das quais, porm, no conhecemos exatamente as suas estruturas e o lxico originrio. O substantivo frrion, cujo significado principal, a partir da poca clssica, fortaleza, posto fortificado, em Diodoro Sculo, historiador romano de lngua e cultura grega, alterna-se a plis para nomear as cidades indgenas. Os pesquisadores da Siclia grega passaram a usar a palavra para se referir s cidades nativas que mostram uma forte caracterizao helnica aps o seu contato com os poikoi. O propsito do presente estudo indagar os assim-chamados frria da Siclia central, a Sicania, prestando uma ateno particular paisagem em que eles se desenvolveram, s suas estruturas urbana e extra-urbana e manifestao por meio da cultura material do envolvimento entre as culturas grega e no grega, do final do VII ao IV sc. a.C. Embora o seu aparente isolamento geogrfico, esta regio desde o Neoltico esteve envolvida nos trnsitos que interconectavam diversas reas da bacia do Mediterrneo, mantendo, todavia, um certo conservadorismo, que ainda no V sc. a.C. a caracterizava. Entre o comeo e a metade do VI sc. a.C., essa rea entrou na rbita de interesse da componente rdio-cretense, entrelaando com ela relaes prevalentemente pacficas e que foram evoluindo conforme as contingncias histricas que determinavam as necessidades e os interesses de uma ou outra parte. As cidades indgenas assumiram papeis particulares com base nas peculiaridades geogrficas ou culturais que as distinguiam e em sintonia com a nova realidade poltica. Entre os elementos levantados, observamos que a escolha do lugar para o assentamento, a organizao do espao urbano e a relao com a economia monetria dos nativos so uma expresso eloquente da nova realidade cultural que comeou se configurar a partir do momento do contato entre as duas entidades. As populaes locais, com efeito, ainda que adotando, em alguns casos, formas arquitetnicas helnicas, se organizaram no terreno de uma maneira bem diferente do tpico esquema ortogonal das apokias; igualmente, elas aceitaram com dificuldade o sistema monetrio como veculo de escambo, continuando a preferir o metal a peso, e por isso as moedas de bronze pesado de Akragas foram as mais difundidas e continuaram circulando tambm aps a sua emisso oficial. Os indgenas permaneceram assentados nos cumes das colinas mais altas at o final do V sc. e, conforme a nossa proposta, esse padro comeou a mudar s a partir do IV sc. a.C., quando aos cidados locais se uniram os mercenrios principalmente de origem peninsular.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Ancient Greek literature has given us a rich vocabulary to describe the way of life of Hellenic peoples throughout the Mediterranean. These same words were used to define the urban and social organization of non-Greek peoples, whose structures and original lexica are largely unknown to us. From the classic era onwards, the principal meaning of the noun phrourion is fort, or fortified outpost, and the Roman, but culturally and linguistically Greek, historian Diodorus Siculus, writing about Greek language and culture, alternates the term with polis to refer to indigenous cities. Scholars of Greek Sicily now use phrouria to refer to native cities still displaying a strongly Hellenic character after their contact with the apoikoi. The purpose of the present study is to investigate the so-called phrouria of central Sicily, Sicania, with particular emphasis upon the landscapes in which they developed, their urban and extraurban structures, and the material culture evidence for interactions between Greeks and non- Greeks, from the end of the 7th until the 4th century BC. Despite its apparent geographic isolation, this region was part of networks that interconnected diverse areas of the Mediterranean basin since the Neolithic. In the first half of the 6th century BC, the region entered the orbit of interest of the Rhodian-Cretan component, entangling predominantly pacific relations that were determined by historical contingencies and the needs and interests of different players. In line with the new political reality, indigenous cities played specific roles that were based upon their location and the cultural factors that distinguished them. It can be observed that the choice of settlement location, the organization of urban space, and the natives' relationship with the new monetary economy, are eloquent expressions of the new cultural reality which begun from the first moment of contact with the Greeks. While still adopting, in some cases, Hellenic architectural forms, local populations organized the land differently to the typical orthogonal scheme of the apokiai. Equally, the monetary system as a barter vehicle was accepted with difficulty. People continued to prefer weighted metal and, as a result, heavy bronze coins from Akragas were the most widespread currency, continuing to circulate long after their official emission. Native settlements continued to be located on top of hills until the end of the 5th century, and it is proposed here that this trend started to change only from the 4th century onwards, when local citizens joined with mercenaries of largely peninsular origin.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Interaction Networks between Greeks and non-Greeks: The Frontier Phrouria in the Hinterland of Greek Sicily

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: People and Movements in Central Sicily: Settlement Patterns and Territory Changes in Antiquity
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: From the late 1970s, Landscape Archeology turned its attention to the role of the interior territories in the economic, political and social changes of the different historical epochs. The countryside, which supplied products for consumption and commerce, was populated by a multitude of people who were active part of the development of large urban centers. We believe that archaeological methods and approaches may offer insightful tools for understanding the history of the place and interpreting settlement patterns in antiquity. The project presented here aims to research a few explored territory of central Sicily to reconstruct its life history and to contextualize it in a general framework, from a long-term perspective. In the field research, we intend to rely on methodologies of topographic survey, which also includes the use of instruments that allow non-invasive interventions. The elaboration of the data through the GIS system will allow the spatial analysis of the movements of the human groups and their relationship with territory and landscape.
